text: Waiting for train but will be there asap
I am dialing in remotely
but will be there with you guys in spirit
i'm on the line - hi guys
hi marce
hi marce
should we move this forward? I know it's kathleen's deal
want to be sensitive to everyone's time
well there you go
kathleen sounds like she might be driving FYI
I want to make sure that we're managing scope changes here
agreed
I wonder if a "more" instead of "settings"
would offer more flexibility and a hook for MWC expansion
thanks, Justin. Agree. these are all "new" things they should have been aware of.
And good idea, <@U026PHQ3J>
Have we already talked localization for CES with them?
and translation
I just want to know if we need to account for that in the designs
ben mentioned they brought it up - which seems like we might need to
Marce - was that in scope for the CES build?
briefly. David had mentioned a few languages on a previous call and our response was to try to avoid as much copy as possible. It would be tied to system settings. So we need to code for it.
i can say that longform text looks awful on device
we'll figure it out
Not specifically - it's pulling from somewhere (and at the moment, it's borrowing from MWC). We need to figure out what that scope is too and figure out how we resource it.
Maybe we lean on Kathleen (guided demo) to see if we actually need localization for a guided CES demo
also not in scope. Their rebrand
We should eventually ask them about the status of getting access to their haptic SDK (beyond their rooting device questions). Esp. if David would desire the haptic patterns to the animations.
They're still working on getting the SDK working on the S
got it. cool. as long as we have a current status of that.
question for us - when do we need that before we're super blocked?
are there hooks that we can plan on?
I can get a head start on collecting animations, I think a lot of what we're thinking of can be implemented with basic jquery
My guess is that we should proceed on the S with bluetooth pairing and faking device to device
Trent would be a good resource on animation references as well if we want to loop him in. <@U0265G76F>
meantime maybe burn a little time on the NDK style stuff maybe working on the tizen build on the Gear 2
at least to provide some insight into maybe jumping ship device-wise
yah that might not be a bad idea
the NDK can only be used on Tizen phone devices (and I assume the emulator)
Boooooo. I wonder tho if since its been more time, if there's some other manner of getting native code crammed into the gear 2
But there is a Samsung API for Gear paired apps that we should probably pursue
It's all controlled by Samsung and there's no native layer, but it seems to be what they're pushing as far as developers interacting with Gears and Android phones
<http://developer.samsung.com/gear>
Gotcha. My assumption when we started this was that Immersion had already done the work on getting this stuff onto the gears
and i think assumption is a strong word here - it was presented as such
Agreed. That was my understanding from our meeting too.
Can we ask about this today once we're done w/ the design chat?
want to make sure we're clear on this
its on basecamp
ah - ok. (Sorry - missed that).
NP, i think Ben and I will craft an inquiry/clarification email
to formalize it a bit
cool. that works for me.
should we ask about Samsung Notes 4?
(not that we're there yet)
are we doing note 4 for CES?
no, that's MWC nm
we've discussed prioritizing single device for CES
note is bonus
nice work, everyone.
<@U02F8TTPU>: does tizen wearable SDK really ship with its own version of chrome?!
No, I found the setting where it invokes Chrome, it is using the installed version, it just adds a bunch of parameters to pop up a new instance each time you run the web simulator
Unsure why that is, but the simulator is not useful to wearable development, so I don't need to use it
ahhh that makes sense
hey - I just wanted to make sure y'all saw the comment about needing the CES demo to support Mandarin
just design-wise for now, but still, that seems like a non-trival design consideration
I didn't see that, so thanks for bringing it to light
agreed
I think mainly shes saying she isn't sure, so we should english localize to start
So we can mandarin localize later
but build with localization in mind out the gate
yeah - but if its ever going to be in there, we need to plan now
(thats nerd speak)
where did it say that?
in basecamp
"We do not have a localization requirement at this time. However, we may eventually need a Mandarin version. Please take that into account when designing and coding the app"
def. did not see that one. thanks for calling it out
it just happened minutes ago

so basically - if they want the app to be designed in such a way that we can just flip the switch at a later date, we need to design for that now. Which Im okay with, but as before, I just want to make sure that a) we're aware and b) it's in scope for this round

from a dev standpoint, I just need to follow Android's pattern and put all strings in a key-value document so they can be translated later. date/time stuff could get tricky, but hopefully we don't have to get super deep into that.

<!channel>: Heads up that I've broken down the conference room sticky-note situation. But it's been recreated on a nice big piece of white foamcore, which now lives over in the West Wing. MWC on one side, CES on the other. (Refer to the basecamp images for the old hand-drawn notes,)
thanks ben!
I have beginning implementations of the splash screen, main menu, and category menu (smartwatch), including tap and swipe but no graphics or animations
also localized according to mozilla's guidelines
I'll back it up to my private dropbox for the near future, but I think a git repo would be a good resource to have soon
Nice.
I have no idea what I'm doing with this tizen wearable IDE
<http://collectionofawesome.files.wordpress.com/2012/01/tumblr_lupel430rw1qmmrpjo1_500.gif>

I have to go get my car now... it's been in the shop in Beaverton for way too long, but the current demo is loaded on the white gear S if you want to try it out (it'll be in the drawer, second from left under our whiteboard), and see you tomorrow!
thanks marissa!
